SEARCH
Package org.ddolib.util.testbench

Class ProblemTestBench<T,P extends Problem<T>>

java.lang.Object
org.ddolib.util.testbench.ProblemTestBench<T,P>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of states.
P - The type of problem to test.
public abstract class ProblemTestBench<T,P extends Problem<T>> extends Object
Abstract class to generate tests on implementations of Problem. The user needs to implement an instance generator and a DdoModel containing all the problem specific components.

    • testFlbOnRelaxedNodes

      protected void testFlbOnRelaxedNodes(P problem)
      Test if the mode with the relaxation and the fast lower bound enabled lead to the optimal solution. As side effect, it tests if the fast lower bound on merged states does not cause errors.
      Parameters:
      problem - The instance to test.

    • testDominance

      protected void testDominance(P problem)

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • assertOptionalDoubleEqual

      public static void assertOptionalDoubleEqual(Optional<Double> expected, Optional<Double> actual, double delta, int width)
      Compares two Optional<Double> with a tolerance (delta) if both are present.
      Parameters:
      expected - The expected Optional<Double>.
      actual - The actual Optional<Double>.
      delta - The tolerance for the comparison if both optionals contain a value.
      width - The maximum width of mdd used for the tests. Used to display error message.
